text: 330ml bottle. Jet black colour with average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, tan head. Chocolately, dark malty aroma, notes of dark chocolate, milk chocolate, fruity coffee, hints of red and blue berries, lingonberry, blueberry. Taste is fruity and chocolately dark malty, notes of coffee with a bitter touch, additional fruity notes of red and blue berries, lingonberry, blueberry, dark chocolate, milk chocolate; oily texture, full body, smooth and soft palate.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: pitch black with big dark head. Aroma: lots of coffee, cacao, earthy yeast, dark chocolate and some dark fruits. Taste: high sweetness and fairly high bitterness. Notes of lots of coffee, cacao, dark chocolate and some dark fruits. Palate: full bodied, oily texture and medium carbonation.

Bottle @ barley House. Marrone scuro velato schiuma.beige finissima persistente. Aroma intenso e complesso, frutta secca nocciole e caffÃ¨ tostatura, caffÃ¨ cioccolato cacao amaro. Note erbacee di luppolo. Gusto abboccato quasi amabile allÂ’ingresso, poi il tostato prevale sul maltato,con caffÃ¨, qualche nota di vaniglia e cioccolato.leggeri sentori aciduli. Rotonda, calda, oleosa, poco carbonata. Equilibrata ed armonica.
Tap @ Christian Firtal, Odense. Pours Black with a creamy beige head. Roast, coffee and ashes. Licorice. Dry roasted charcoal bitter finish. Solid!

Strong roasted coffee and a hint of alcohol in aroma. Coffee and roasted malts dominate the taste. Perfectly balanced and very rich in flavors. Thick and creamy texture. Chocolate and coffee again in a long-lasting finish. Balance is the key here and this is so damn well mastered.
0,33 bottle. Nera con schiuma grossolana nocciola. Aroma: cacao, caffÃ¨ e fruit cake. Gusto idem. Corpo pieno. Buon equilibrio tra dolce dei malti e amaro da tostature.

Ein Meisterwerk!!! Es duftet nach Fass/Holz, Tabak, Leder und die Kaffeebohne. Wow. Die Optik und der Trunk PERFEKT. Erstgenannte glÃ¤nzt durch ein tiefschwarzes und permanent braunbeschÃ¤umtes Outfit. Letztgenannter durch eine wahnwitzig samtige Textur, Flavours von Mandel und Zartbitterschokolade, harzige Hops und die Dryness der EspressosÃ¤ure. Komplex und ausgereift bis unter die FussnÃ¤gel ðŸ˜ƒ. Need more!!!! Mein 0,33l FlÃ¤schchen war gut durchgereift und bereits abgelaufen ðŸ˜‰. Hammerzeug!! BEYOND BEER HH.
How: bottle Appearance: black, small tanned head. Aroma: strong coffee aroma, some chocholate, caramel, citrus, cocoa, wood. Palate: almost a full body, soft carbonation.

33 cl bottle from Liquorstore The Pint (discounted because close to the BB date) @ home. Pours pitch black with a big brown head, reasonable retention. Heavy roast in the nose with some red fruit, drop and light soy sauce. Retronasal itÂ’s sweetish, drop, light roasted, light fruit. Flavor is moderate sweet, a bit roasted. Slightly high carbonation with makes the body seem a bit thin. The finish is again heavy roasted and moderate bitter. Pretty good.
Draught @Rbarbarrab. Black with light brown head. Coffee, cocoa and roasted malts in aroma. A hint of sweet chocolate and lots of roasted bitterness. Great beer!

Zwart kleurig bier met een bruine/creme kleurige schuimkraag. 

Aroma:
Geroosterde mout, koffie en mokka. 

Smaak: koffie, geroosterde mout, melkchocolade, misschien wat vanille, wat drop in de afdronk en aangenaam licht bitter.

Redelijk veel koolzuur, had graag wat minder koolzuur gehad.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours pitch black with a huge frothy tan head. Aroma of liquorice, leather, tobacco, coffee and some barrelnotes. Taste is weak dry roasty overall, well blended liquorice, roasted malts, coffee, nice long weak bitter finish, good one.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Bottle at home. Pours pitch black, plenty of beige coloured head, lasts a bit. Aroma of roased malt, coffee. Tastes follows with black coffee, dark, unsweetned chocolate, dark malts, sweet and bitter. Body is medium, soft carbonation. Very, very good.
From tap at new bar I donÂ’t know how to pronounce. A black beer with a beige head. Aromaand flavour of dried fruit, spice, bitterness, roasted malt and caramel.

Strong aroma with a roasted malt in abundance, bitter dark chocolate, coffee with milk, smoked black fruits with a bit of rum. Sweet and bitter taste (very pleasant), with roasted malt in abundance, coffee with a bit of milk, bitter dark chocolate, peach and walnuts jam. Very good!

(PÃµhjala Must Kuld - Kenyan Coffee Edition) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 7.8%
Thick pour, black coloured beer, tall and thick dark brown head on top, very good retention.
Aroma has milky chocolate, light roasted malts, coffee.
Taste has more coffee, more roasted malts too, dark bitter chocolate, milky chocolate.
Medium thick boy, good carbonation.
Very good.

330 ml bottle at home. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate, some caramel and some fruity notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours black with a burgundy tint and a strangely fizzy head, that dissipates in no time. Distinct coffee dominating the aroma. Medium body, soft, pleasant, sweetish roast base with some coffee on top. Nice one alright. 100117

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway, on order. Pitch black color, plenty of brownish foam. Medium/full aroma intensity; coffee, leather, licorice, malt. Medium full body & complexity. Good bitterness and balance. Very enjoyable
Draft. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has roasted malt, and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt and chocolate, leading to a dry finish

Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700. [ As PÃµhjala Must Kuld - Kenyan Coffee Edition ].Clear dark black brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, moderate coffee, dark malt. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, roasted, coffee, dark malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160515]
 7-4-8-3-15
Zwart bier met stevig donkerbruin schuim. Smaak is krachtig, ietwat zoet met iets van rook, chocolade en koffie.

Very good one. Comparing to regular version, this one is more smooth, more coffee with milk, slightly more acidic, slightly more herbal and bitter, more woody. Palate is really good tho. After few sips you can feel freshly brewed coffee. Podsumowanie: W porÃ³wnaniu do wersji podstawowej taj jest o dziwno bardziej kremowa, laktoaz troche bardziej wyczuwalna. Za to wiÄ™ksza kwasowoÅ›Ä‡, goryczka wrÄ™cz ocierajÄ…ca siÄ™ o trochÄ™ zioÅ‚owa nutÄ™. Kawa wyczuwalna po koniec, CiÄ™Å¼ka sprawa z tÄ… ocenÄ… piwo dobre, na pewno nie zanudza, pijalnoÅ›c bardzo wysoka, ale wiÄ™cej niÅ¼ 3.8 nie dam ;)

Pours dark brown with some light brown foam coating. Aroma has deep roast, strong toffee base that is supporting fresh drip of coffee. Brew itself is dense, full of roast and toffee and dark fruits. Nice balance, coffee is not too much but still standing strong and definitely expressive. Bitter chocolate linger in the finish. Great beer, I like it probably even better than the base version of Must Kuld.
Dark brown color. Slightly sour nose, roasted malt, coffee, good roasted malt and bitterness. Well balanced, nicely structured, medium full body. Good chocolate and coffee finish.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium thin beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and syrup. Medium sweet taste with some bitterness. Medium body.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Pitch black, big mocha head. Big dark chocolate truffles aroma, lots of sweetened coffee (that does not stand out), coffee liqueur. Moderate alcohol and bitterness, light roast. Full of flavour, yet easy drinking. Excellent.

Bottle from Kisjes Slijterijen, Meppel. Aroma is huge coffee, espresso, roasted malt, dark fruits, mocha, cocoa, dark berries, touch of dark chocolate and tobacco. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet and moderate bitter. Body is above medium. Massive coffee, roasty cocoa mocha espresso beans, with a surprising touch of dark fruits. Pretty great coffee porter!

It pours like an imperial stout, jet black with a creamy frothy beige/brown head. The aroma is not so powerful: coffee for sure, quite earthy, then roastiness, hops, some hints of chocolate.
The flavour follows the nose, the coffee is more present though it isnÂ’t so distinctive..and being a coffee porter I was expecting a coffee bomb both in the aroma and flavour (the bottle is quite fresh: "just" 3 months old, so the coffee shouldÂ’ve been there). Medium body, soft carbonation, almost oily texture. Overall a pretty decent beer. But nothing to remember.

33cl bottle at home from Oedipus Int. Beer Festival 2016. Nose is roasted malt. Body is pitch black, head is very big, brownish, rocky, mostly lasting, good lacing. Aroma is dark roasted coffee, roasted malt, smoked old wood, dark chocolate, coal, toast. Light sweet, heavy bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty and hoppy heavy bitter. Full body, dry texture, average carbonation. Bit heavy due to bitterness, fine hoppy and roasted coffeeish bitterness combination, sweetness is not really present but I donÂ’t mind, great one.
Jet black with a colossal, thick head that has a beautiful mocha colour. Aroma is freshly ground coffee. Taste leads with bold coffee and finishes with a dash of milk and sugar.
Bottle @ banksia copenhagen. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with a nice coffee flavour a bit fizzy. Dry finish

F: huge, brown, good retention.
C: dark as a night, opaque.
A: coffee, tobacco, roasted malt, dark bread, nutty, strong expresso, light vanilla, 
T: malt, roasted malt, coffee, expresso, nutty, vanilla, hint of tobacco, dark bread, dark fruits, medium to full body, normal carbonation, roast-bitter on the palate, nice beer worth to try, BB: 21/03/2017, 0,33l bottle from Malting Pot in Brussels.
Bottle from uba ja humal. Black with xl chocolate brown head. Dark berries, strong coffee, roasted, quite sweet. Lots of carbonation.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from Mikkeller web shop cons 2016-11-21 GÃ¶teborg
AR: rich fruit African coffee, dark chocolate
AP: dark brow, wee stouty deminishing dark cream brown lid
F: rich fruit African coffee, dark chocolate, wee grainy, lactose, peppery
Heerlijke koffie porter. Wat hem speciaal maakt is dat hij naar verse koffie smaakt. Net belegen, en de juiste dosis en verhouding. Verder heerlijke zwarte chocolade in het kielzog een fijne hop.

Bottle from De Caigny, batch 209 BB 21 03 17, large sample. Dark color, medium frothy head. Aroma of molasses, roast, coffee, bit tar and ashes. Caramle sweetness in taste, molasses, coffee and roast, bit dark bread crust, milk chocolate. Sticky palate. Good stuff.
330 ml. bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma of strong coffee and chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, and some dark fruit. Very coffee forward. Nice.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Gitzwart, bruine foamy volle schuimkraag die lang blijft, veel koolzuur langs het glas. Aroma: Fruitig, chocolade, donker geroosterde mouten, zoetig, lactose, verse koffie maar licht.Smaak: Een fruitige zoet, lactose, vanille, melk chocolade , zoethout en als laatste een volle sterke gebrande koffie smaak. Hoppige bitter met een prikkeling, alcohol merk je niets van.Medium tot volle body, zacht en romig....redelijk dik, rustig koolzuur, olieachtige lacing langs het glas, afdronk is bitterzoet.Heel goed! Net even beter dan de gewone Must Kuld.

Bottle @McHendoÂ’s, Kishan is leaving, will he come back Tasting II. Pours black beige head. Nose is coffee, big coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate. Taste is the same as the nose but with a vanilla and slight licorice thing going on.

Bevuta in bottiglia, scuro, quasi nero, con una schiuma beige cremosa.
Al naso aromi di caffÃ¨ intenso e cioccolato. Al palato dolce, maltato e leggermente tostato gusto del dolce caffÃ¨, nocciola, vaniglia e cioccolato al latte. Corposa e morbida. Molto buona.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, blackcurrant, liquorice, coffee, taste is sweet toffee, chocolate, liquorice, coffee.

BBE 21.03.2017. Musta, iso kuohuva ruskea vaahto, tuoksu viettelevÃ¤n lakritsaisan makea, suutuntumassa hapokkuutta, palaneisuutta, vahvahko, lievÃ¤sti kahvimainen, ei kuitenkaan yhtÃ¤ makea kuin perusversio, siksi jÃ¤Ã¤ vÃ¤hÃ¤n jÃ¤lkeen.
Black with big tan head. Fresh coffee, fruity, earthy, tree bark and chocolate syrup. Slick, sweet and oily finish. Overall: great!

330 ml bottle.

Dark brown nearly black with brown head. Roasted taste with coffee and chocolate.

Lukt: Kaffe, krisebÃ¦r, mÃ¸rk sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt skum.
Smak: Kaffe, kirsebÃ¦r, mÃ¸rk sjokolade.
Hvor: WhatsBryne tasting hos Untapd Jostein.
Medium: [emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */,8%, NÃ¥[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Bottle at home.
Pitch black coloured with a huge beige head.
Roasted aroma of coffee and vanilla with notes of berries.
Roasted flavour of coffee and berries with notes of vanilla.
Roasted finish.

Czarne jak smola, piana wysmienita , aroat rozny od kawy czeklady a na orzechach konczac, smak podobnie, Alko dobrze ukryte, super goryczka na koniec . Znakmpmity dmak od gorzkiej kawy poprzez slodkie aromaty a konczac na chmielowej goryczce

0.33l bottle from #208. A massive head on this one! ItÂ’s both creamy and almost fluffy. Superbly lacing and darker brown, all this over a deep dark brown colored bodied beer. It smells nice also. Hoppy at first, then more roasted after the head has had a chance to settle a little. Both sweet licorice and mild coffee is present here. Soft sugary also, but never cloying. Like the aroma, it taste a lot better! Wow! This is one tasty coffee porter! Totally blown away by the massive deep dark coffee rush this one actually provides to the taste budss thick and oily in the mouth while itÂ’s just above soft on the carbonation scale. Having a sip then exhaling it just gives this massive coffee dark roasted heavy deep rush of flavors. Been a while since IÂ’ve tasted anything like this. And itÂ’s not even a heavy weighter this! Blown away and super impressed over how nice and flavorful this one is. Thumbs up! 15.10.2016
Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, coffee, licorice and chocolate. Flavour is roasted, coffee, licorice, medium sweet and light to medium bitter.
Bottle. Black beer, creamy brown head. Aroma of licorice, coffee, malt and chocolate. Smooth flavor of chocolate, mocha coffee, licorice, creamy malt and mild red fruit. Very nice.

Tap beer. Una stout ben fatta. Colore nero intenso, schiuma ridotta ma persistente. Al naso lÂ’aroma ricco, forte di caffÃ¨ appena preparato. di cioccolato al latte, miele e ribes nero. Gusto sapori di frutti di bosco come la marmellata di mora ribes e lamponi, e, soprattutto sapore di caffÃ¨ e di malti tostati. Retrogusto lungo ed avvolgente.

Draft sample at Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 04.07.2016. Day Two. Pour it dark color with medium black head. Aroma of dark chocolate. Taste lots of nice smooth roasted coffee feel, creamy smooth texture, dark chocolate, really good Porter, medium body, soft carbonation, bitter.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is dark roasted malt, dark roasted coffee, chocolate, caramel, cocoa. Full body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Roasted bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle at home thanks to fonefan! Almost black with dark brown head that leaves a little ring. Really lots of coffee, toffee, creamy fudge, lactose, sour berries, light bell pepper, grass, hay, sweet malts. Medium sweet and bitter with a light sour touch. Medium bodied with creamy feel and lots of carbonation. Bit messy, might be infected?

Bottle at home. Pitch black with brown head. Big sweet deep roasted choco malts, fresh coffee, deep roast coffee beans, bitter dark chocolate, molasses. Medium sweet, mild cocoa bitter. Over medium body, soft carbonation. Sticky sweet texture and lovely bittersweet roasty finish.

My Bottom Line:
Huge coffee dips into vanilla cake and lactose in this flavorful Coffee Stout.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the darkness.
-This is pretty effervescent for the style, but it works well.
-Mild acidity is felt, probably from the chosen coffee and/or the roasted malts.
-Drinkability is quite high for this type of brew.

Bottle.
From tap. Aroma of coffee with fruity notes, dark chocolate, roasted malt. Black, lasting tan head. Taste is moderate malt bitter, light+ sweet. Full body, sirupy feel, malt bitter finish.
Bottle at home, black beer, huge medium head. aroma is roasted, coffee, chocolate. Taste is the same. very nice.

Ebony black, deep and dark, dense & creamy light brown head, good lacing. Sweet aroma with bitter roasting, mushrooms, coffee, licorice. Medium body, slick, roasted bitter, dry finish, sweet opening, soft carbonation.Good, balanced, tasty.

Appearance: black, clear, rocky head, brown foam, lasts good. Aroma: valerian, roasty, dark bread. Taste: medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, alcohol. Palate: medium body, lively, thin feel, bitter, long finish,

Black beer with big brown head. Wonderful aroma with chocolate, vanilla, caramel, creamy coffee and wood. Taste is also salty liquorice, coffee and woody. Oily and creamy, little carbonation, almost full body. Wonderful porter.

Pours black with beige long lasting head. Aroma is roasted fruits, plum, dried fruits, raisin, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, something sourish, bitter. Taste is soft, coffee, light toasted bread, medium roast coffee, oil, cream pie. Very good beer!

Bottle 
Aroma-coffee, caramel, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish
Overall-very good
Bottle at Home.Black colour with medium beige head.Aroma is mild fruity of tart fruits and lot of coffee i guess from Kenya nice with good full body and creamy slight sour finish.

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, small tan head. 
Slightly sweet nose, roasted malty taste with a sweet finish. 
Full body, fizzy carbonation makes for at good palate.

Bottle. Black color with tan head. Aroma is aromatic grated coffee, black chocolate. Taste is good coffee, earthy, a bit vanilla even? Quite dry and luscious. Soft mouthfeel. DoesnÂ’t have this bocky molasses feeling the regular version has. There was some seriously good coffee at work here. A ridiculously good Porter, but you feel the body of 7.8%.
Bottle, 33 cl, bought at "upper glass", Mannheim. Nice porter; warming, coffee prominent.
@ Basunen 16-7-13: mycket kaffe bÃ¥de i doft och smak. LÃ¥ng eftersmak. Fin balans. Fin bitterhet.

Aromat intensywny, kawa, popiÃ³Å‚, palonoÅ›Ä‡, lukrecja, czekolada. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana brÄ…zowa, obfita, drobna, trwaÅ‚a, Å‚adny lacing. W smaku wytrawne, Å›rednia peÅ‚nia, ogrom kawy, palonoÅ›Ä‡, wanilia, czekolada, lukrecja, drewno, popiÃ³Å‚. Goryczka Å›rednia, wysycenie niskie.
First Estonian beer. Black color with tan, lasting, head. Huge and nice coffee aroma. Coffee in the taste, with some dark chocolate and dark fruits. Splendid.
A really superb coffee porter. Deeply roasty. Lots of coffee and some dark chocolate. Light licorice and a little acidic.

0,33l bottle at home shared by Saeglopur, big thanks. BB 21.03.2017. black color, medium big coffee-colored head. smells coffee grounds, bitter herbal, nettle, lightly earthy, light vanilla. good smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, bitter herbal, coffee grounds, vanilla, licorice, bitter chocolate, roast. finishes earthy bitter and roasted with notes of coffee and bitter chocolate. quite good beer but was expecting a bit more though.

330 ml bottle, bb 21.03.17, from BeerLovers, Vienna.
Almost black body, with a massive, dense, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of coffee beans, espresso, dark chocolate, cocoa, some wood, some caramel.
Taste follows this, with subtle dark fruits 
Medium, oily mouhfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty, a bit dry, a bit wooden, with a lot of coffee again, subtly sweet, a bit alcohol warming.

Tasty. Not that complex, but with loads of lovely coffee notes and very well balanced, drinks really smooth. Another quality beer by this brewery and a great style example.

Bottle from Beergium, ordered in May 2016. 

Black with a creamy tan head. Quite a lot of coffee both in the aroma and taste. Also chocolate and roasted malt. Nicely balanced and with a rather bitter finish. A tasty one.

Bottle. Aroma of freshly roasted coffee, chocolate, wood, nuts. 
Pours almost pitch black with a dense brown head. 
Taste is medium bitter and light to medium sweet. Loads of coffee and nuts in the taste. No that complex. 
Medium body, a bit oily to watery texture, little too much carbonation, ends roasty and pleasantly bitter. 
Enjoyable porter that could do with a little tweaking.

Sampled from tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Pitch black with a light brown head. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty aroma of coffee, milk chocolate and hazelnut. Sweet, malty and slightly roasty taste of sweet coffee, hazelnut, vanilla and milk chocolate, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (CBC Week), Copenhagen - pours black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted sweet malty, slight burnt dark malty notes, with big roasted coffee prominence, some chocolate, caramel, cocoa, dry roasted finish.

Pours black with a thick tan head, good lace. Sweet creamy coffee and chocolate and a bit roasty aroma. Taste: roasty bitter with coffee and bitter chocolate, creamy, a hint of sweetness and bitter coffee finish. Strong body and medium carbonation.
Aroma full of coffee with tones of bitter chocolate. Pours black with a large, tan head. Rich flavour, very balanced between bitter and sweet. Full bodied, average carbonation, bitter finish. Nice.
Bottled:Black with a creamy head.Aroma is coffee, chocolate, licorice and dry wood.Dry taste with notes of coffee, char coal and bitter chocolate leading to a warming finish.

Black color with huge, brown head. Aroma is really nice with milk chocolate, sweet coffee and fudge. Taste starts sweet with a good amount of coffee flavor and finishes with coffee bitterness and roasted malt. Really smooth mouthfeel. Overall this is a really good coffee porter, one of the best I had recently.
Black colour, medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, dark berries, vanilla. Dry, lightly sweet taste, with medium bitterness. Medium body and average carbonation.

20cl glaasje bij pint, Maastricht 

Uiterlijk: zwart met mooie cremelaagje 

Aroma en smaak: koffie, chocolade, gebrande mouten

Conclusie: erg lekker deze 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Tartu. Pours dark brown with big fluffy brown head. Aroma: roasted, peas, raddish, coffee, chocolate. Taste: medium bitter, roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, Medium to full body. Bitter finish. Easy to drink. Mine kind of porter.

Black body, big brown head. Aroma has rich chocolate and coffee. Some grainy and ashy malt. Flavour has very dry feeling. Some coffee, very fruity coffee indeed. Bit dark chocolate. This leans to the dry side, very long aftertaste. ThereÂ’s no complexity, quite one sided, but balanced.

33cl bottle. Pitch black pour with a tall espresso head with excellent retention, that eventually gives way to a nice lacing. Notes of dark cherries, brewed coffee, roasted malts, subtle vanilla and a very mild and very pleasant sourness. Medium body with medium carbonation and a coffee-chocolate roasty aftertaste.

33cl Bottle from Vonk. Black colour, beige head. Aroma of liquorice, laurel, earthy coffee, vanilla beans, CafÃ© Noir cookies. Flavour follows, lots of liquorice, not much coffee tbh, a bit fizzy. Light to medium bodied.

Drank 29-5-2016 while writing in my diary. The coffee taste is quite soft, not really outspoken. Not bad, but a bit too soft for me. Aftertaste is rich. A bit weird, Â’cannyÂ’ taste sometimes. Good beer but a bit sterile, had higher expectations.

Correct name according to the label is Must Kuld Kenya Porter - Coffee Edition, depicting a roasted coffee bean - still a bit suggestive, but not half as much as that of the regular version... Thick, creamy, dense, deep tan coloured head, dissolving gradually and eventually vanishing, very dark chestnut brown robe but only visible on the edges, otherwise black. Aroma of elderberry, damp forest floor, coffee grounds and cold remains of black coffee but not really the delicate fresh coffee bean fragrancy I was hoping for, cigar tobacco somewhere, bitter chocolate, iron but not in an industrial way, ripe blackberry, earthy beetroot, burnt toast, hints of salmiak, leather, bayleaf, oyster mushroom, fermenting tree leaves, balsamico. Soft blackberry- and blackcurrant-like, fruity sourishness in onset balanced with restrained fig and peach sweetishness, with a slight mushroom-like umami touch to it; spritzy carbonation, a bit minerally but no numbing effect, fortunately. Oily, slick mouthfeel, deeply nutty maltiness, bittersweet with again that dim sourishness on top it - must have something to do with those coffee beans. Finish continues this flavour whilst adding spicy, leafy hop bitterness, pleasantly coffeeish roasted barley bitterness underneath the added coffee beans, a faint kind of soft smokiness and some warming, rum-like alcohol; the spritzy carbonation makes things feel lighter than they probably are and adds a specific kind of sourishness to it but I wonder if a lower carbonation would not have been better suited for a coffee porter. Earthy, leathery, a tad overcarbonated and more Â’deeplyÂ’ sourish (without acidity) than expected: I had better coffee porters and stouts, but it is certainly a bit different and in all quite enjoyable. I liked the regular version more, though.

[5/15/16] Draught at Fermentoren in Copenhagen. Black with a tan head. Aroma of roast, coffee, a bit "green". Roasty flavor, rather dry, slightly sweetish, with lots of coffee, roast, some dark chocolate. Medium to full-bodied, rounded mouthfeel. Very nice.

28.05.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Huge light brown fizzy-creamy shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly sour-ish roasted, coffee, roasted grain, minerals, dark malts, grass, bark, alcohol, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is slightly dry and sour-ish roasted, dark malts, sour coffee, bark, cocoa, vanilla, grass, mocha, weeds, caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly sour-ish and watery mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation. Fair enough.

Bottle, 7.8%. Black with big dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, chocolate, caramel, wood and dark chocolate. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, espresso, wood, liquroice, medium sweet, hops, smoke and medium bitter.
33cl bottle at home. Hazy dark brown with a medium tan head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice bitter tones. Coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, spices and caramel. Good stuff.

Draught at Fermentoren, Pohjala tap takeover. A fawn-coloured head blanketing the glass. Coal black body. Attractive smell of coffee. Coffee flavours with some impact of creamy chocolate. Ashy palate. Slightly roasted bitter ending. Smooth on the swallow. Pleasant stuff (Copenhagen 15.05.2016).

Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi zwart bier met een bruine schuimkraag, flink wat carbonatie. Aromas zijn gebrande mout, caramel en een flinke neus koffie. Het bier komt door het koolzuur in eerste instantie fris over, maar daarna komt de stevige smaak van gebrande mout, koffie en caramel. Een heerlijke koffie-variant op de al briljante reguliere Must Kuld. Heerlijk!

(hand)bottled (thanks TM). Black colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is big time espresso, some toffee, roasted malts and some ashes. Flavour is coffee, very dry wooden burnt notes with some ashes and some slight caramel. Very ashy dry and roasted notes as aftertaste. Brutally big coffee stuff. Brilliant, but a bit over the border for me. Still very nice.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Almost completely black beer. Lively larger airy brown head, disappears quick.
Aromas of coffee, roast, ash, coal, light hint of cough syrup and liquorice...
Flavour is black: coffee, roast, coal, malt roast, wood roast, coffee roast, bitter, hint of liquorice and sweet tar...
Aftertaste is bitter, roast, coffee and earthy coal tints.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Decent!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle shared by Erwin Van Moll @ Brewpub Van Moll. Very dark brown color with a slight dark red glare coming through when held into the light, medium to full sized dark brown head that lasts for quite a while. Aroma is malts, roast and coffee. Taste malts, roasted malts, coffee roast, liquorice, firm dark malt bitter. Lingering coffee roast and coffee roast bitter. Medium body, light to moderately oily texture, quite firm carbonation yet somehow not annoying. Quite nice.

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours pitch black with a medium mocha head. Aroma is full of coffee, chocolate, coconut, malts, fudge, dark fruits. Taste is fruity coffee, roasty, chocolate, coconut, malty. Well made!

Draft at Fermentoren. Black with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee, roast, oatmeal, malt, chocolate and light fudge. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Draught at Fermentoren, Copenhagen.Opaque black beer with a nicebeige/brownish head. Chocolate and coffee aroma, licorice, spicy notes, some figs and raisins. Chocolate and coffee flavor, licorice, espresso, some tar and dark chocolate. Quite nice.

Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Poured almost black with a frothy tan head. The aroma is roasty malt, coffee, chocolate. The flavour is roasty smoke liqourice bitter with a dry coffee, roasty palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Roasted malty, coffee and chocolate malty. Roasted, dark malty and coffee. Herbal and bitter. Roasted finish.
Tap @ Fairbar, Aarhus. Pitch black with a beautiful tan head. Notes of sweet cocoa, fruit coffee, vanilla fudge and some caramel. Smooth and delicious!

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of fruity ground coffee, cocoa, dark malts, roasted malts and vanilla. The taste has lots of fresh coffee, roasted malts, acidic coffee notes, vanilla and chocolate. Nice coffee porter indeed!

Bottle, pours black with a tan head. Coffee beans, espresso, mocha, dark and sweet chocolate, vanilla, caramel, ash, citrus. Medium sweet and bitter, light astringency. Excellent balance (for someone who loves espresso....).
Tap @ Fairbar. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Oily. 090516
Pours black, not much head. Smell is coffee, bitter black malts, roasty. Taste is bitter, coffee, ( too much coffee ) , burnt malts. Ashy. Ok
Black full-bodied ale, with rich coffee aroma and flavour, on top of the malt bill. Balanced sweetness and bitterness, with a light tart note. Overall, a great coffee porter.

duft: svag kaffe ristet noder ristet chokolade 
smag chokolade kaffe ristet malt lang eftersmag

Draught @ Fairbar. Pours black with a creamy brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, rich coffee, green coffee beans, dark chocolate. Flavor is light sweet, malty, dark chocolate, rich coffee, sweet chocolate. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, dry and bitter finish. 070516
Tap @ Fairbar. Nice creamy tan head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, coffee, chocolate, caramel and hops. Nice bitter finish.

Tap @ Konttori.
Pours pitch black color with a small off-white head. Aroma is quite roasty and dry malty, cocoa and some coffee notes. Coffee is more present on the flavor, dry cocoa powder, dark roasted malts and hops. Bitter palate, sticky sugary sweet finish. Very nice and refined Porter bordering an IS.
4525

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate, molasses, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts caramel, liquorice, molasses, mocha and chocolate; ends medium bitter and slightly dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. I really like dark, bitter beer with loads of coffee and this beer delivers. Holy shit this beer is amazingly rich and intense.

Bottled. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, coffee, licorice and vanilla. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Porter. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

The aroma is full of coffee, chocolate, tar, smoke, citrus, wood, fire and earth. The color is pitch black with a brown head. The taste is full of coffee, chocolate, hops, citrus and caramel. A nice beer!

Draught. Black in color with tan head. Roasted malts, mild vinous and cold coffee notes in aroma. Coffee and bitter cocoa notes in taste. Bit of chocolatey and licorice notes later on. Quite smooth for that matter as well. Nice bitterness and coffee awaits in the end.

sample from bottle, poured a fairly clear light brown colour with a tanned head on top. nose of light toasted malts, caramel, light cacao bitterness, vanilla, and fairly fainted light coffee notes, finish of slight bitter coffe, but more of a mocha / latte kind. itÂ’s weak, even some fruits in the finish. but better compared to the failed cherry version.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2016 Tap at Rotterdam, Helsinki. Opaque black color, good beige creamy head. Aroma has licorice, vanilla and toasted maltyness. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Soft palate. Licorice, toasted malts, coffee, cocoa, finish has some hoppyness. All nicely balanced. No typical coffee bean veggie notes. World class brew.

9/IV/16 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 16/III/17 (2016-336) Thanks to sebletitje for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, huge creamy beige head, stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of coffee, roasted, cocoa powder, bit sourish, vanilla. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, lots of coffee, caramel, mocha, cocoa powder, some ripe banana, bit yeasty. Aftertaste: little hoppy, bitter, coffee, cocoa powder, vanilla, some caramel.
Bottle at tderoeck's place, thanks! Coffee, but not alot and more like cheap one, light chocolate and some roast. Ok beer.

Bouteille de 33cl de SIP, Tallinn.
Batch#206, BB 16.03.2017.

Palais est maltÃ© avec un excellent grillÃ© et lÃ©ger cafÃ©, ce dernier reste bien prÃ©sent avec un bel accompagnement de lactose.
Au final, je me demande si ces versions nÂ’auraient pas Ã©tÃ© mieux sans le lactose. Petite amertume houblonnÃ©e perce en fin de bouche. Un porter bien exÃ©cutÃ© penchant vers un cÃ´tÃ© baltique, et une bonne dose de fruits noirs.

Tap @ BrewDog Helsinki, thanks Gastjale. Pours dark brown, black with a small, latte-colored head. Aroma is a huge whiff of strong coffee. Nuts, coffee, some roast. Taste has more roast, but coffee is very strong again.

Draught at Brewdog Helsinki. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, hops, nuts, licorice, espresso, dark fruits and a bit of vanilla. Bitter finish with roasted malts, hops, nuts, licorice, espresso and dark fruits. Exquisite porter.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2016 Bottle. Batch 206; BB 16.03.2017. Pours dark brown-black with a beautiful, thick tan head. The head drops to a film later on. The aromaÂ’s luckily not beany at all, itÂ’s very roasty, almost burnt roasty. Swirling and warming helps the coffee become more lively, also making it more beany... Tastes expectedly roasty, sweet, a bit acidic, recalling black bread. ThereÂ’s also a creamy side to it, familiar from the original Must Kuld. Carbonation moderate, palate oily-slick. Gets better - more coffee-forward and beany - at room temperature. 

Edit: another try, same batch. Looks stunning. The aromaÂ’s lovely. So is flavour. Carbonation actually rather active, which is surprising considering the original Must Kuld. No, I was too harsh at first. This is excellent - I like it more than the original. Now IÂ’m eagerly waiting for BBA and raspberry versions.

Bottle. Nose is coffee, slight beaniness, roast, chocolate. Flavor is roast, dark chocolate, cocoa, smooth coffee. Finishes with roast, coffee, mild bitterness and coffee acidity. I usually donÂ’t like coffee stouts because the coffee in them tends to be stale. Not the case here, so it tastes very nice.
Bottle at drink baar, tallinn. Black color, brown head. Aroma has roasty notes, coffee and chocolate notes. Nicely roasted body, coffee, smooth.

Bottle. Pours a very dark body with a medium tall tan head. Aroma has big time well roasted coffee, not leaving room for anything else. Taste is more or less what you would expect from the aroma - lots of coffee, rich roast etc (I admit, I wouldnÂ’t make a good coffee reviewer). Finish has that burnt and oily roasted coffee bean bitterness but IÂ’d prefer there to be more hop freshness involved. But itÂ’s still a great coffee beer. This is a beer that is best consumed as fresh as possible. My sample seems to be less than ten days old but IÂ’d imagine a several months old sample (the typical age of beers appearing on the shelves somewhere far) is not as good.

black liquid with brown head. aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts. tastes same but more, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Dark brown, almost black colour. Beige medium head. Aroma of roasted coffee beans, bitter chocolate, cream. Bitter chocolate, cocoa nibs at first. Roasted coffee beans in the middle. Bitter and sour coffee beans in the end. Creamy and bitter aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, very well balanced, silky and very tasty beer.

Bottle, batch 206 (from UJH, Tallinn). Pours dark brown-black with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is coffee, green coffee beans, dark chocolate, some butter, roast, vanilla. Flavor is sweet and bitter, coffee, green coffee beans, roast, fruits, citrus, lactose. Finish is intense roast-coffee-dry-dark chocolate bitter. Overall: very nice coffee beer, but the "beaniness" gets a bit overwhelming.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 Tap (TCBW15) (5:3:5:3:9=2.6)
Smells of beans. Tastes of stout with runner beans added. Nope. Full palate, but carbonation high. Poured black witha a huge tight head and with messy sticky lacing. Finish is burnt and beany. I donÂ’t like beans.
Rerate: Tap (Pudel, Tallinn) (7:4:7:3:14=3.5)
What a difference! Rich coffee roast. Smooth full palate, were it not for harsh carbonation. Rich roast taste, pleasant coffee, a bit espresso-ey. Finish pleasantly burnt and bitter. Niiiice.
Rerate: 330ml bottle (Pothouse, Tallinn) (7:4:6:3:13=3.3)
OK, siding with the better sample here. Delicious dark rich milky coffee aroma. Black as yerÂ’at. Palate still a little dry and burnt, as is the finish, so itÂ’s a sipper more than a glugger. Must Kuld always has been at the very limits of my burntness tolerance, sometimes outside it, and this one again toys with the very border itself.
UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 Tap @ TCBW2015. 27032015. Colour is black with small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Massive coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts.

Tap @TCBW2015. Pitch black color. Massive size, brown head, stays. I need a spoon! Coffee, flourish, roast, dark chocolate ... and beans in aroma. Roast, sourish cold coffee and beans in taste. Medium bitterness. No carbonation. Surprisingly light. I rue FatPhil and his beans nonsense, but once beans hit me I canÂ’t unbean it! Damn....

Tap @ Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2015


Dry and salty with coffee tones. Good one.

Draught @ TCBW 2015

Pours pitch black with a foamy head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee beans, cocoa, hints of berries and licorice. Taste is roasty, heavy with coffee, mocha, espresso and berries. Finish is roasty and a coffee overdose. Pretty tasty still.

On tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend. Black with a huge light brown head. Intense aroma of freshly roasted coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits and some slightly vinous notes. Fairly sweet and quite delicious with a decent bitterness too. Well balanced and very tasty. Excellent coffee beer!

Tap @TCBW15. Pitch black, thick dense espresso head. Strong coffee aroma, roasted malt, coffee beans. This is all about the coffee. Dry finish with coffee. Flavor has sweet malt, Ash, tobacco notes and loads of coffee. Well, if u like coffee and beer this is your must brew to drink.

Taptcbw15. Black, tan creamy top. Strong roasty dry coffee nose, roasty malts, some sweet licorice. Med full, nice easy fluffy texture, cleann finish. Coffee beans, dried coffee, dry chocolate. I loved the ordinary must kuld, and this is just as good.-- bb

Draught @ Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2015
Lots and lots of foam. Aroma has mocha coffee, hayish tones, some truffles and hints of vanilla. Flavour has slightly bitter, cold coffee and some dark chocolate. Also slightly ashy. No CO2 on palate. Nice and smooth stuff still.
